attributes.action: introduce UK standards for hospitals to abide by when dealing with women suffering miscarriages.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Campaign For UK Standards On The Treatment Of Miscarriages.

Following my own terrible hospital treatment, and after hearing many stories of women who have suffered additional trauma with the lack of care from their local hospital during/after going through a miscarriage, I have set up this petition with an aim to introduce UK standards for hospitals to abide by when treating women in this difficult situation.

Afterall, how can we expect appropriate and acceptable treatment from our hospitals when they don't even have guidelines on how they should be treating us?

So, I have created a list of recommendations which can be viewed on my Facebook page - Campaign For UK Standards On The Treatment Of Miscarriages - everything from wanting earlier scans to confirm a miscarriage, to getting the appropriate aftercare.

I'm not asking for the world - these recommendations aren't expensive and they're not impossible, they're simply what every woman deserves.
